title: Review Verbs (To Be, Have, Group A).
reading_greek: Είμαι φοιτητής. Έχω ένα βιβλίο. Εγώ μιλάω ελληνικά. Εσύ είσαι καλός μαθητής. Αυτός έχει μια γάτα.
reading_english: I am a student. I have a book. I speak Greek. You are a good student. He has a cat.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 12... Today, we will review some important verbs: 'to be', 'to have', and Group A verbs... Listen to this reading... [Reading Greek] Είμαι φοιτητής. Έχω ένα βιβλίο. Εγώ μιλάω ελληνικά. Εσύ είσαι καλός μαθητής. Αυτός έχει μια γάτα. ... Now, let's break down the verbs... 'Είμαι' means 'I am'... 'Έχω' means 'I have'... 'Μιλάω' means 'I speak'... Notice how these verbs change depending on who is doing the action... For example, 'είμαι' (I am) becomes 'είσαι' (you are)... and 'έχω' (I have) becomes 'έχει' (he/she/it has)... Keep practicing these verbs to build a strong foundation in Greek!
